symptoms: dyspnea with normal pulmonary function tests

diagnoses: Allergic reaction (e.g., drug allergy, food allergy)
Autoimmune thyroiditis (Hashimotos thyroiditis or Graves disease)
Drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms (DRESS)
Anxiety/Stress (While not a direct cause of the physical symptoms, anxiety can exacerbate them)
Hypothyroidism (in some cases, despite hyperthyroid symptoms being listed, hypothyroidism can cause delayed puberty)
Brain tumor (affecting the pituitary or hypothalamus)
Chronic illness (e.g., celiac disease, inflammatory bowel disease)
Neurological Disorders (e.g., Epilepsy - further investigation needed for pseudoseizures)
Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) - Crohns disease or ulcerative colitis
Inner ear disorders (e.g., labyrinthitis, Menieres disease)
Genetic disorders affecting the nervous system
Neurodegenerative disorders (e.g., Alzheimers disease, frontotemporal dementia)
Central nervous system infections (e.g., meningitis, encephalitis)
Connective tissue disorders (e.g., lupus, rheumatoid arthritis)
Bone marrow disorders (e.g., aplastic anemia, myelodysplastic syndromes)
Infectious causes (e.g., HIV, hepatitis C, syphilis)
